abstract: Some early obstacles are emerging to Citigroup‘s big Asia bid, which it announced Wednesday. The bank’s $10.8 billion offer for Japanese brokerage Nikko Cordial was being touted as a much-needed coup for Citigroup’s chief executive, Charles O. Prince III, who has been under pressure from shareholders to improve firm’s performance.
lead_paragraph: Some early obstacles are emerging to Citigroup‘s big Asia bid, which it announced Wednesday. The bank’s $10.8 billion offer for Japanese brokerage Nikko Cordial was being touted as a much-needed coup for Citigroup’s chief executive, Charles O. Prince III, who has been under pressure from shareholders to improve firm’s performance.

headline.main: Citi Faces Obstacles in Japanese Bid
